semantic_identifier: 13: feat: Add regression coverage + monitoring to cap fit-tier impact under negative deal dynamics

sections.text:
## Description

Implements GOLD-97 guardrails to prevent fit-tier from overpowering procurement/competition/internal-alignment risk signals.

Changes:
- Regression test suite
  - Adds scenario-based fixtures derived from the GOLD-97 audit report to represent high-fit accounts with negative deal dynamics (procurement friction, strong competition, poor internal alignment).
  - Adds assertions that:
    - forecasting score is penalized/capped when any negative deal-dynamics signal is present, regardless of fit-tier.
    - best-next-action rankings demote “aggressive” actions and prefer risk-mitigation actions when negative signals are active.
    - component-level contributions respect configured caps (fit-tier cannot exceed threshold share of total when negative signals are on).
  - Tests are deterministic and run in CI; failures surface which component exceeded thresholds.

- Scoring instrumentation + monitoring
  - Emits score breakdown metrics (total score + per-component contributions, including fit-tier and each deal-dynamics risk component) with tags for workspace/model-version.
  - Adds dashboards showing contribution distributions and a focused view for “negative deal dynamics present” cohorts.
  - Adds alerts that trigger when fit-tier contribution exceeds configured thresholds under negative deal dynamics for a workspace over a rolling window.

- Configuration
  - Introduces/updates centralized thresholds (caps/penalties) used by both tests and monitoring so audits can adjust limits without code changes.

Operational notes:
- No scoring logic changes beyond adding observability hooks; this PR enforces expected behavior via tests and alerts to catch regressions early.
- Alert thresholds default to the GOLD-97-derived values and can be overridden per environment/workspace.

## How Has This Been Tested?
